2. Multiple adenomas: Adenomas are benign (non-cancerous) growths that can develop on the lining of the large intestine. Multiple adenomas refer to the presence of more than one adenoma in the colon or rectum.
3. I1307K: This is a specific genetic mutation or variant of the APC gene. The "I" represents isoleucine, and "K" represents lysine. The mutation results in the substitution of isoleucine with lysine at position 1307 in the APC protein.
4. Ashkenazim: Ashkenazim is a Jewish population originating from Central and Eastern Europe. This group is known to have a higher prevalence of certain genetic mutations that increase the risk of certain diseases, including colorectal cancer.
